abstract: One week after “Desperate Housewives” returned for its fourth season on ABC, the network’s Sunday night line-up remained down but still solid in the ratings, finishing second only to NBC’s live football coverage. While audiences for the ABC shows fell by millions of viewers compared with their week-ago debuts, “Desperate Housewives” remained No. 1 overall with 17.4 million viewers at 9 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates.
